SEARCH

Class BigTwo

java.lang.Object
BigTwo
public class BigTwo extends Object
The BigTwo class implements the CardGame interface and is used to model a Big Two card game.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    BigTwo()
    a constructor for creating a Big Two card game.

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove(int playerIdx, int[] cardIdx)
      a method for making a move by a player with the specified index using the cards specified by the list of indices. Broadcasts the current player's move to others over the network.
      Parameters:
      playerIdx - index of the current player.
      cardIdx - indexes of the cards to play.

    • checkMove

      public void checkMove(int playerIdx, int[] cardIdx)
      a method used by all users to validate the move made by the current player, upon receiving information over the network.
      Parameters:
      playerIdx - playerIdx index of the current player.
      cardIdx - cardIdx indexes of the cards to play.

    • endOfGame

      public boolean endOfGame()
      a method for checking if the game ends.
      Returns:
      a boolean denoting the end of the game.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      a method for starting a Big Two card game.
      Parameters:
      args - list of command line input arguments.

    • composeHand

      public static Hand composeHand(CardGamePlayer player, CardList cards)
      a method for returning a valid hand from the specified list of cards of the player.
      Parameters:
      player - player that owns the hand.
      cards - cards contained by the hand.
      Returns:
      valid hand or null if there are no valid hands.
